name: aslppaacodes
title: ASLP PAA Codes
description: Set of codes representing all concepts used in the paa policies

concept.definition: Home/portable monitor sleep testing
Qualifying Patient Age for Sleep Testing
Excessive Daytime Sleepiness (EDS)
Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS) Score >= 10
Qualifying Excessive Sleepiness While Driving
Loud/Intense Snoring

concept.display: Witnessed Nocturnal Apnea, Choking and/or Gasping
concept.definition: Witnessed Nocturnal Apnea, Choking and/or Gasping

concept.display: Qualifying Absence Of Comorbid Medical Conditions
concept.definition: Home/portable monitor sleep testing - Absence Of Comorbid Medical Conditions

concept.display: Qualifying Moderate To Severe Pulmonary Disease
concept.definition: Moderate To Severe Pulmonary Disease

concept.display: Qualifying Moderate To Severe Pulmonary Disease Including COPD
concept.definition: Moderate To Severe Pulmonary Disease Including COPD

concept.display: Qualifying Moderate To Severe Pulmonary Disease Including Asthma
concept.definition: Moderate To Severe Pulmonary Disease Including Asthma

concept.display: Qualifying Neuromuscular Disease With Associated Pulmonary Disease
concept.definition: Neuromuscular Disease With Associated Pulmonary Disease
Cardiac Disease
Home/portable monitor sleep testing - Uses A Qualified Device
Home/portable monitor sleep testing - Safe Equipment Use At Home
Home/portable monitor sleep testing - Physician Evaluated Results

concept.display: Qualifying Diagnostic Testing With Diagnosis of OSA
concept.definition: Diagnostic testing prior to planned hypoglossal nerve stimulator (HGNS) implantation for an individual with a known diagnosis of OSA
History of or clinical features associated with central sleep apnea (CSA)
History of or clinical features associated with narcolepsy when a multiple sleep latency test (MSLT) is planned
History of or clinical features associated with obesity hypoventilation syndrome (OHS)

concept.display: Qualifying Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) with EDS
concept.definition: History of traumatic brain injury (TBI) with excessive daytime sleepiness (EDS)

concept.display: Qualifying Idiopathic Central Nervous System Hypersomnia
concept.definition: Idiopathic central nervous system hypersomnia when a multiple sleep latency test (MSLT) is planned

concept.display: Qualifying Impairment Affecting Safe Use of Equipment At Home
concept.definition: Individual or caregiver lacks cognitive function, dexterity, or mobility to use portable monitor (PM) equipment safely at home
Mission critical profession including, but may not be limited to: airline pilots, bus drivers, military personnel and truck drivers
Parasomnias that are unusual or atypical because of duration, frequency, or time of the behavior

concept.display: Paroxysmal Arousal or Other Sleep Disruptions Thought to be Seizure Related
concept.definition: Paroxysmal arousals or other sleep disruptions thought to be seizure related
Periodic Limb Movement Disorder (PLMD)
